  physical_appearance: This is a batik sarong. The left of the sarong features an orange panel
 with small stars decorating the background. The panel is bordered by flowers and leaves on a scrolling tendril. The main body of the sarong has a blue background. Large bouquets of European flowers interspersed with butterflies and birds is shown on the sarong. There is a signature on the top-left of the batik.

  subject_terms_1: Peranakan folk costume flower (motif) foliage (motif) cultural diffusion

  subject_terms_2: Batik Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people) Motifs Culture diffusion

  subject_terms_3: Batik Peranakan costumes

  sgcool_label_text: The buketan design
 comprising large bouquets of European flowers interspersed with butterflies and birds
 is shown on this sarong.  Single blooms fill the cloth
 creating a cascading effect and injecting movement to the design.  Tiny star motifs in starburst design on the blue
 main design field (badan) and arranged in circles on the peach
 vertical band (kepala) further enhance the design.  This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Kok Sing (1896-1966)
 the second in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  Her later batik designs attest to her virtuosity in technique and inventive colour palette.  Her repertoire of tiny isen-isen motifs (filler motifs within the outlines of the key motifs) in particular
 exudes a strong sense of artistic individuality
 possibly informed by modernist designs on European printed cloths.  Her treatment of floral bouquets is also charactertistic of the undulating and curving lines of the Art Noveau style that was introduced in the northern coast of Java by the Europeans.  This piece is signed “Nj Oey Kok Sing”.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a batik sarong. The left of the sarong features an orange panel, with small stars decorating the background. The panel is bordered by flowers and leaves on a scrolling tendril. The main body of the sarong has a blue background. Large bouquets of European flowers interspersed with butterflies and birds is shown on the sarong. There is a signature on the top-left of the batik.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: The buketan design, comprising large bouquets of European flowers interspersed with butterflies and birds, is shown on this sarong.  Single blooms fill the cloth, creating a cascading effect and injecting movement to the design.  Tiny star motifs in starburst design on the blue, main design field (badan) and arranged in circles on the peach, vertical band (kepala) further enhance the design.  This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Kok Sing (1896-1966), the second in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  Her later batik designs attest to her virtuosity in technique and inventive colour palette.  Her repertoire of tiny isen-isen motifs (filler motifs within the outlines of the key motifs) in particular, exudes a strong sense of artistic individuality, possibly informed by modernist designs on European printed cloths.  Her treatment of floral bouquets is also charactertistic of the undulating and curving lines of the Art Noveau style that was introduced in the northern coast of Java by the Europeans.  This piece is signed “Nj Oey Kok Sing”.
